greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table T(k, n) of smallest bases b > 1 such that p = prime(n) satisfies b^(p-1) == 1 (mod p^k), read by antidiagonals.
example: T(3, 5) = 124, since prime(5) = 11 and the smallest b such that b^10 == 1 (mod 11^3) is 124.
program: (PARI) for(k=2, 10, forprime(p=2, 25, b=2; while(Mod(b, p^k)^(p-1)!=1, b++); print1(b, ", ")); print(""))
xref: Column 2 of table appears to be A024023 (with offset 2).
Column 3 of table appears to be A034939 (with offset 2).
results.author: _Felix Fröhlich_, May 10 2015
